diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Acute hepatitis B virus and hepatitis delta virus coinfection in the presence of chronic hepatitis C virus infection.
diagnosis.differential_diagnosis: Acute liver injury due to ischemic hepatitis, pancreaticobiliary disease, drug-induced liver injury, viral hepatitis.
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with jaundice and elevated liver enzymes consistent with acute hepatitis. Testing revealed positive results for HBV surface antigen, IgM antibodies to HBV core antigen, and HBV e antigen, along with a high HBV DNA level, confirming acute HBV infection. The presence of chronic HCV infection was established, leading to the conclusion of HBV and HDV coinfection.
